data.title: Minimum cost for projects
data.statement:
Your company requires some management application for different departments, and you now have two lists for your projects namely:

[[projList]] for list of projects
and
[[projBids]] for list of bids

The bids from [[projBids]] are aligned to [[projList]] list to represent the bids of tech consultants for the projects above, example:

<<['HR', 'Inventory, 'HR', 'Inventory', 'Inventory']>>
<<[7, 4, 74, 477, 4]>>

First on the list is the bid for 'HR' which is 7
next is the bid for 'Inventory' which is 4
next is the bid for 'HR' which is 74
next is the bid for 'Inventory' which is 477
and lastly, the bid is for 'Inventory' which is 4

Your goal is find the <<minimum cost>> to complete the projects from the list

Lowest bid for 'HR' project is 7 and for 'Inventory' is 4 which totals to <<11>>

testCases.title: Test 3
testCases.testIn:
7
Sales Ops CS Accounting Ops Production Inspection
78 23 98 105 69 271 143

testCases.title: Test 4
testCases.testIn:
8
Finance Marketing QA Distro Storage Design Support Procurement
120 340 770 60 293 300 150 58

testCases.title: Test 5
testCases.testIn:
6
R&D R&D R&D Dispatch R&D Dispatch
78 69 78 57 929 1024

data.stubGenerator:
read n:int
loopline n projList:string(600)
loopline n projBids:int
write minimum cost
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1>>: An integer [[n]] for the number of projects
<<Line 2>>: [[n]] space-separated strings [[projList]] for the list of projects
<<Line 3>>: [[n]] space-separated integers [[projBids]] for the list of bids for projects above
data.outputDescription: [[minCost]] minimum cost for projects to be completed.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Your company requires some management application for different departments, and you now have two lists for your projects namely:

projList for list of projects
and
projBids for list of bids

The bids from projBids are aligned to projList list to represent the bids of tech consultants for the projects above, example:

['HR', 'Inventory, 'HR', 'Inventory', 'Inventory']
[7, 4, 74, 477, 4]

First on the list is the bid for 'HR' which is 7
next is the bid for 'Inventory' which is 4
next is the bid for 'HR' which is 74
next is the bid for 'Inventory' which is 477
and lastly, the bid is for 'Inventory' which is 4

Your goal is find the minimum cost to complete the projects from the list

Lowest bid for 'HR' project is 7 and for 'Inventory' is 4 which totals to 11
Input
Line 1: An integer n for the number of projects
Line 2: n space-separated strings projList for the list of projects
Line 3: n space-separated integers projBids for the list of bids for projects above
Output
minCost minimum cost for projects to be completed.
Constraints
1 ≤ n ≤ 10
1 ≤ projBids ≤ 1e6
Example
Input
5
HR Inventory HR Inventory Inventory
7 4 74 477 4
Output
11
